pages.text: Placodus (meaning "flat tooth") was a genus of placodont marine reptile that lived during the Middle Triassic. Remains of this animal have been found in Germany, France, Poland, and China. The strong jaws and teeth (including chisel-like incisors) of this shallow-water animal suggest that it ate hard-shelled food, such as bivalves.
